inlineContent.text: For most of the attributes, a minimum, target (ideal), and maximum value can be
not be smaller than the minimum or larger than the maximum.
The total number of seed artists, seed tracks, and seed genres must add up
to retrieve the available seed genres.
Note that all of the properties are mutable.

abstract.text: The tunable track attributes used in the
endpoint for getting
recommendations based on seeds.
Retrieve a list of available genres seeds for recommendations.
A cursor-based paging object.
The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM).
The key the track is in.
An album type.
A Spotify image object.
Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. “Ooh” and “aah” sounds are
treated as instrumental in this context.
Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of
intensity and activity.
Get the current user’s top artists, calculated based on affinity.
An array of genres.
Get the current user’s top tracks, calculated based on affinity.
A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a
track.
A Swift library for the Spotify web API
A Spotify user.
An array of track URIs.
Get Spotify Catalog information about albums, artists, playlists, tracks,
shows or episodes that match a keyword string.
Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a
combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat
strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0
is most danceable.
The popularity of the track.
A Spotify Cursor object.
A Recommendations Response Object. Returned by
A Spotify copyright object.
Other objects in the object model.
The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB).
A Spotify category object.
A Spotify track link object.
Get Recommendations Based on Seeds.
A Time Range. Used by the
and
methods.
A Recommendation Seed Object. Part of the response returned by
A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic.
1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.
The duration of the track in milliseconds.
The response from the search endpoint:
Mode indicates the modality (major or minor) of a track, the type of scale
from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and
minor is 0.
A Spotify paging object.
A saved track object, saved album object, saved episode object,
or saved show object.
Creates the query dictionary that is ultimately used in the endpoint to
request track attributes:
An array of simplified album objects wrapped in a paging object and a localized
message that can be displayed to the user, such as “Good Morning”, or
“Editors’s picks”.
The tunable track attributes used in the
endpoint for getting
recommendations based on seeds.
An estimated overall time signature of a track.
Creates the tunable track attributes used in the endpoint for getting
recommendations based on seeds.
Represents a range for a track attribute. Has a minimum, target (ideal), and
maximum value. See
and the endpoint for getting
recommendations based on seeds.
A Spotify followers object.
An array of artists URIs.
Detects the presence of an audience in the recording.
Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track.
An array of simplified playlist objects wrapped in a paging object and a
message that can be displayed to the user, such as “Good Morning”, or “Editor’s
picks”.
A type that can compare two of its values for approximate equality.
